p: Like other enveloped viruses, VEEV virus is susceptible to disinfectants such as 1 % sodium hypochlorite, 4 % formaldehyde, 2 % gluteraldehyde, 70 % ethanol, 3–6 % hydrogen peroxide, 2 % and peracetic acid (Collins and Kennedy 1983). Microbial inactivation is possible using moist or dry heat (Block 2001). Togaviruses can be inactivated by 15 min of heat at 65 °C (Lelie et al. 1987).
